article_title: Readers share views on voter restrictions, gender issues, bipartisan efforts
article_text:

00:17 Royals versus White Sox game postponed

01:57 Black faculty still scarce at University of Missouri

03:52 Royals Mike Moustakas talks about his torn right ACL

04:02 Mike Moustakas' torn ACL discussion with Sam Mellinger and Rustin Dodd

00:35 Andy Reid explains how Knile Davis has handled his demotion

01:14 Dickinson County tornado destroyed eight homes

02:27 Americans agree, it's time for Obama to visit Hiroshima

article_metadata.news-keywords: voter restrictions, gender issues, bipartisan efforts
article_metadata.description: May 7, 2016: Sen. Will Kraus, a Lee’s Summit Republican, has been fighting to disenfranchise Missouri voters since he has been in the Missouri Senate (5-4, A4, “Voter ID law passes in Missouri Senate”). Voter fraud is a non-existent problem that Kraus wants to solve.
article_metadata.title: Readers share views on voter restrictions, gender issues, bipartisan efforts | The Kansas City Star
